property.name: Text
property.value:
If this skill test is successful, add Intrepid to your play area as an asset with the text:
"You get +1 έ, +1 ή, and +1 ί.
Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Intrepid."

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach to a [[Firearm]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Place 2 ammo on that asset. Limit 1 per asset.
Attacks performed by attached asset deal +1 damage against [[Monster]] enemies.

property.name: Text
property.value: η Exhaust Otherworldly Compass: Investigate. Your location gets -X shroud for this investigation. X is the number of revealed locations connected to your location.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play during any θ player window.
Choose an enemy at your location. Test έ (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you succeed, treat that enemy's fight value as if it were 0 for the next attack performed against it this phase. Draw 1 card.

property.name: Text
property.value:
You get +1 έ and +1 ί.
θ Exhaust Lola Santiago and spend X resources: Discover 1 clue at your location. X is the shroud value of your location.

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When you would reveal a chaos token, exhaust Olive McBride: Reveal 3 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 2 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.

property.name: Text
property.value: Ignore the effects of all α, β, γ, and δ symbols during this test (including their modifiers).

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play during any θ player window.
Put Premonition into play, reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag, and seal it on Premonition.
Forced - When a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag: Resolve the token sealed here as if it were just revealed from the chaos bag, instead. Then, discard Premonition.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play after a skill test you failed ends (after resolving all effects from the failed test).
Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Take Heart to any type of test.
If this test fails, the performing investigator draws 2 cards and gains 2 resources.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play when you perform a skill test with a difficulty higher than your base skill value.
Reveal X additional chaos tokens for this skill test. Choose one to resolve and ignore the others. X is the difference between the test's difficulty and your base skill value.

property.name: Text
property.value: You get +1 ί during evasion attempts.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Uses (1 ammo). Limit 1 ammo on Ornate Bow.
η Spend 1 ammo: Fight. This attack uses ί instead of ή. You get +2 ί and deal +2 damage for this attack.
η: You nock another arrow. Place 1 ammo on Ornate Bow.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: -1 (-3 instead if you are in a [[cave]] location). β: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on your location. γ: -2. If you are poisoned, this test automatically fails instead. δ: -3. If you fail, take 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: -2 (-4 instead if you are in a [[cave]] location). β: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on your location. γ: -3. If you are poisoned, this test automatically fails instead. If you are not poisoned and you fail, put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in your threat area. δ: -4. If you fail, take 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Resign. "Let's make camp and solve this puzzle tomorrow." η: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, look at the top 3 cards of the exploration deck. Place 1 on the bottom and the other 2 on top, in any order.

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Check your supplies. If you have a map, look at the top 2 cards of the exploration deck. Discard each treachery looked at by this effect. Shuffle the exploration deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.

property.name: Text
property.value: After exploring the rainforest for hours, you reach the top of a steep ridge, from which you can see much of the surrounding area. Uncanny winged creatures caw at you from above, circling over the cavern entrance like vultures waiting for their meal. From this vantage point, you may be able to see approaching threats as they traverse the brush below. If only you had something to help you see farther... Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. The lead investigator chooses one investigator to be the group's lookout. That investigator checks his or her supplies. If the lookout has binoculars, he or she is able to see the creature approaching and avoid it. The lookout suffers no ill effects. If the lookout does not have binoculars, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy at the lookout's location.

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Night comes swiftly, blanketing the rainforest in dim moonlight. The sounds of the jungle change as nocturnal creatures start to emerge. Soon, the air is filled with the buzzing and chirping of strange insects and even stranger beasts, the identity of which you are unable to determine. The dangers of nighttime are too great to ignore, and the darkness makes it difficult for you to study the glyphs and patterns necessary to shift the pillars correctly. You have no choice but to set up camp and continue your exploration in the morning. Each surviving investigator immediately resigns.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn - Mouth of K'n-yan. Alert. Hunter. Massive. Cannot be defeated. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced - After a pillar token is placed on the Mouth of K'n-yan: Exhaust The Winged Serpent. It does not ready during the upkeep phase this round.

property.name: Text
property.value: η Investigators at the Mouth of K'n-yan spend 1π clues, as a group: You solve one piece of the puzzle. Add 1 resource to the Mouth of K'n-yan, as a pillar token. Objective - Solve the puzzle of the six pillars in order to enter K'n-yan. If there are 6 pillar tokens on the Mouth of K'n-yan, advance to act 2b.

property.name: Text
property.value: With a deep rumbling that shakes the ground outside, something inside the cavern shifts. In a distinct sequence, the six obelisks slowly descend into the ground, twisting and turning. The serpent creature that guarded the cavern lets out a shriek of anger and hate before flying off and vanishing behind the treeline. One by one, the stone pillars disappear into the dirt, and the Earth stops shaking. (->R1)

property.name: Text
property.value: η If there are no clues on your location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. Forced - When this agenda advances: Do not remove doom from each location in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Check Campaign Log. If the Harbinger is still alive: From the entrance far behind you, a threatening hiss and an all-too-familiar rattling causes you to freeze in terror. You grip the nearest weapon you can find and turn in fright, hands trembling. How has it followed you this far? When will this awful hunt end? Search the collection for the Harbinger of Valusia and spawn it at the location farthest from all investigators (if there are 8 or more tally marks under "Yig's Fury" in your Campaign Log, it enters play at the lead investigator's location, instead). It enters play with damage on it equal to the amount of damage recorded in parentheses in your Campaign Log.

property.name: Text
property.value: η If there are no clues on your location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. *This agenda gets +1π doom threshold.

property.name: Text
property.value: Without warning, a deafening crash echoes throughout the cave, and the ground under your feet rumbles with tremendous force. Stalactites and pieces of crumbling rock begin to fall from the ceiling of the cavern, striking the ground all around you and causing cracks to appear in the stone. "We have to get out of here!" you shout to Ichtaca, but by the time you realize what is coming, it is too late. The ground beneath your feet gives way, and suddenly you are falling, plummeting into the depths below... Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

property.name: Text
property.value: With very few landmarks to spot along the dark and lonely tunnels, you must rely on your wits and navigation skills to make your way forward without getting lost. If only you had an easy way to mark the places you have already visited... Shuffle Descent to Yoth into the exploration deck. The lead investigator chooses one investigator to be the group's scout. That investigator checks his or her supplies. If the scout has chalk, you are able to avoid traveling in circles. The scout suffers no ill effects. If the scout does not have chalk, place 1 clue on each location in play . Then, if the scout is on a single-sided location, shuffle that location back into the exploration deck. Move each enemy and investigator that was at that location to a connecting location nearest to the Mouth of K'n-yan.

property.name: Text
property.value: Objective - If each surviving investigator is at the Descent to Yoth and there is no doom on it, you may advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Before you lies an ornate and elaborately decorated doorway, a stone disc that has been rolled aside to unveil the hellish realm beyond. The caverns on the other side are bathed in a red glow. The serpent-themed statues and carvings along the walls inform you that you are on the right track. Check Campaign Log. -: (->R1). -: (->R2).

property.name: Text
property.value: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): -Test ί (3) to attempt to jump the gap. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage. -Shuffle Pitfall into the exploration deck. You cannot choose this option if Pitfall was drawn from the exploration deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at the attached location who is poisoned takes 2 horror. Each investigator at the attached location who is not poisoned must put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in his or her threat area, instead. Discard Poisonous Spores.

property.name: Text
property.value: η η: Choose a non-[[elite]] card worth vengeance points in the victory display. Place that card in the encounter discard pile. (Group limit once per game.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you enter Stone Altar: Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a ε, α, β, γ, δ, or ζ symbol, lose 1 action. If you cannot, take 1 horror instead.

property.name: Text
property.value: Alert. Retaliate. Forced - After Apex Strangleweed makes an attack of opportunity against you: Check your supplies. If you do not have a pocket knife, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Prey - Nearest to the Mouth of K'n-yan. Hunter. Forced - After a pillar token is placed on the Mouth of K'n-yan: Shuffle one copy of Basilisk into the encounter deck. (Max once per round.) Vengeance 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Test ί (4). For each point you fail by, discard a random card from your hand or choose and discard a card from your play area.

property.name: Text
property.value: As an additional cost for you to explore while at Vast Passages, check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has binoculars, you must spend 1 additional action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you put Hall of Idolatry into play by successfully exploring: Check Campaign Log. If there are 5 or more tally marks under "Yig's Fury", draw the top card of the encounter deck (top 2 cards instead if there are 10 or more tally marks).

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After Dark Hollow enters play, check your supplies. If no investigator has a map: Place 1π additional clues on Dark Hollow.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Perilous Gulch: Check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has rope, place 1 doom on Perilous Gulch.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you enter Crystal Pillars: Test ά (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vengeance point in the victory display. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After Descent to Yoth enters play: Each investigator must either place 1 doom on Descent to Yoth or draw the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. ι After you successfully investigate Descent to Yoth: Instead of discovering clues, you may flip 1 doom on Descent to Yoth to its clue side. Vengeance 2. Victory 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Attach No Turning Back to your location or a connecting location. Limit 1 per location. Investigators cannot enter or leave attached location. η: Test ή (3) or check your supplies. If you succeed, or if you have a pickaxe, discard No Turning Back. Any investigator at a connecting location may activate this ability.
